page.title: 02THE M6 AND THELWALL VIADUCT
page.content: The viaduct was built in 1963 and is over 1 mile long. It carries the M6 over{The Manchester Ship Canal}and{The {River Mersey.}At the moment (summer 1985) there are traffic problems because of repair work. Long delays occurr at busy times of the day. The viaduct is very tall and can be seen all over the area. The Grandfather of one of our group helped to build the viaduct and his wife was one of the first people to walk across the finished bridge. Underneath the viaduct you can see concrete pillars and many sets of steps going up. It is very noisy. In the future there may be work to make the road wider or even a second bridge to carry the ever increasing traffic using the M6 motorway.
